alert.note: Alert for Harris; Meriwether; Talbot; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Meriwether, southeastern Troup, northwestern Talbot and eastern Harris Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 600 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near F.d. Roosevelt State Park, or near Hamilton, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Greenville, Manchester, Pine Mountain, Woodbury, Waverly Hall, Warm Springs, Gay, Ellerslie, F.d. Roosevelt State Park, Mountville, Cataula, Flint Hill, Odessadale, Stovall, Big Springs, Fortson, Mulberry Grove, Rocky Mount and Raleigh. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
